description.short: AI-powered universal search that connects and searches across 100+ cloud applications, files, and tools from a single interface
description.detailed: Dropbox Dash is an AI-powered universal search and organization tool that allows users to search across all their connected work applications (Google Drive, Slack, Notion, Gmail, etc.) from a single search bar. It uses AI to understand context, surface relevant information, and provide answers with source citations. Dash includes features like Company Voice Guide (brand consistency), Stacks (smart collections), and AI-powered summaries.
description.primary_function: Universal search across disconnected SaaS tools and cloud storage
key_capabilities: AI-powered answer generation with source citations
Company Voice Guide for brand-consistent AI responses
Stacks: Smart collections that auto-update based on search criteria
Browser extension for universal search bar (Cmd+E)
File preview and quick actions without switching apps
Intelligent summarization of documents and conversations
Secure credential management for connected apps

use_cases.title: Find Information Across All Work Apps
use_cases.description: Search for a topic (e.g., 'Q3 revenue projections') and get results from Google Drive, Slack, Notion, email, and other connected apps in one view
use_cases.time_saved: 15-30 minutes per search vs. manual app switching

use_cases.title: Generate Answers with Citations
use_cases.description: Ask Dash a question and receive AI-generated answers with links to source documents across all connected tools
use_cases.time_saved: 20-40 minutes vs. manual research and synthesis

use_cases.title: Maintain Brand Voice Consistency
use_cases.description: Use Company Voice Guide to ensure AI-generated content matches company style, tone, and terminology
use_cases.time_saved: 10-15 minutes per content piece on style alignment
use_cases.user_persona: Marketing teams, communications teams, customer support

use_cases.title: Create Auto-Updating Collections (Stacks)
use_cases.description: Create a Stack with search criteria (e.g., 'all customer feedback from last month') that automatically updates as new content matches
use_cases.time_saved: 30-60 minutes per week on manual list maintenance
use_cases.user_persona: Product managers, project managers, team leads

use_cases.title: Monitor Industry Research Automatically
use_cases.description: Set up Stacks to monitor arXiv, industry publications, and internal research repos for specific topics
use_cases.time_saved: 2-4 hours per week on research scanning

core_features.description: Browser extension (Cmd+E shortcut) provides instant search across all connected apps from anywhere
Get AI-generated answers to questions with links to source documents for verification
Upload brand guidelines to ensure AI responses match company tone, style, and terminology
Create collections based on search criteria that automatically update as new content matches
Perform actions (open, share, download) directly from search results without switching apps
AI-powered summaries of documents, emails, and conversations
Centralized, secure storage of authentication credentials for connected apps

workflows_enabled: WF-PM-009: Conduct Universal Search Across Work Apps
WF-PM-012: Prepare for Meeting with Stakeholder Context

efficiency_gains: 85% reduction in time spent switching between apps
60% reduction in 'where is that file?' questions
50% faster onboarding for new team members
roi_metrics.value_proposition: For teams using 10+ SaaS tools, Dash becomes the single source of truth and access point, eliminating context-switching overhead

security_privacy.data_handling: Dropbox indexes metadata and content with user permission; does not store credentials in plaintext
security_privacy.access_control: User-level permissions inherited from source applications
security_privacy.encryption: AES 256-bit encryption at rest and in transit

known_limitations: Requires OAuth connection for each app (initial setup time)
Search quality depends on source app's API and data structure
Company Voice Guide requires manual upload of brand guidelines
Some niche apps may not have integrations yet
Real-time sync may have 1-5 minute delay for some platforms
limitations.best_for: Teams using 5+ cloud applications, distributed teams, knowledge-intensive work
limitations.not_ideal_for: Single-app users, highly regulated industries with strict data residency requirements

task_templates: Task-Template-062: Conduct Universal Search Across Work Apps
Task-Template-064: Setup Company Voice Guide for Brand Consistency
Task-Template-065: Prepare Meeting Context with Dash Search

discovery_source.video_title: Interview with Morgan Brown - Dropbox Dash Product Strategy
key_insights: Morgan Brown (VP Product at Dropbox) discusses Dash as solution to app proliferation problem
Company Voice Guide feature specifically designed for brand consistency
Stacks feature enables 'living documents' that auto-update
Integration with arXiv mentioned as example of research workflow
Emphasis on search as fundamental interface for knowledge work

differentiators: Company Voice Guide (unique brand consistency feature)

setup_recommendations: Connect highest-usage apps first (email, chat, docs)
Create Stacks for recurring searches (e.g., 'weekly team updates')
Upload brand guidelines to Company Voice Guide early
Train team on Cmd+E keyboard shortcut
Set up monitoring Stacks for industry research
usage_patterns: Use natural language queries (not keyword stuffing)
Leverage AI answers for synthesis, verify with source citations
Create Stacks for projects/topics you revisit weekly
Use Company Voice for external-facing content
Combine with Dropbox file storage for centralized workflow

version_history.changes: Initial tool entry created from Video_016.md taxonomy extraction

name: Dropbox Dash
